description: OSINT-focused MCP servers that can enhance investigation capabilities

socmint.name: Social Media Intelligence
socmint.description: Tools for investigating social media presence, accounts, and online identities

servers.name: Maigret
servers.description: A powerful OSINT tool that collects user account information from various public sources

network_scanning.name: Network Scanning & Reconnaissance
network_scanning.description: Tools for network intelligence, device discovery, and infrastructure analysis

servers.name: Shodan
servers.description: MCP server for querying the Shodan API and Shodan CVEDB for IP reconnaissance, DNS operations, vulnerability tracking, and device discovery

servers.name: ZoomEye
servers.description: Tool for obtaining network asset information by querying ZoomEye using search parameters and dorks

servers.name: DNSTwist
servers.description: A powerful DNS fuzzing tool that helps detect typosquatting, phishing, and corporate espionage

servers.name: OSINT Toolkit
servers.description: Unified interface for network reconnaissance with parallel execution of OSINT tools including WHOIS, Nmap, DNS lookups, and typosquatting detection

threat_intelligence.name: Threat Intelligence & Analysis
threat_intelligence.description: Tools for analyzing files, URLs, and indicators of compromise

servers.name: VirusTotal
servers.description: Tools to analyze URLs, files via hash, IP addresses, domains, and retrieve relationships for detailed analysis

usage_notes.for_claude: When recommending MCP servers to the user, consider the investigation type and suggest relevant servers. For people investigations, prioritize SOCMINT. For infrastructure/technical investigations, prioritize network scanning tools.
usage_notes.installation: Most MCP servers can be installed via npm or run as Docker containers. Check individual GitHub repositories for installation instructions.
usage_notes.api_keys: Some servers require API keys. Help the user understand which keys are needed and where to obtain them.
